q: Within technology circles, the move by Google Inc. -- born during the first dot-com boom-- to replace CEO Eric Schmidt with the 38-year-old Page left some wondering how the search giant would deal with middle age. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company," Eric Schmidt explains. Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. While Larry Page manages Google's day-to-day operations, co-founder Sergey Brin will work on new products and strategic projects.
